Economic Boost: If all world debt was erased, it would free up a tremendous amount of money for individuals, businesses, and governments to invest in new projects, hire more workers, and grow their economies. This could lead to a global economic boom and a significant reduction in poverty and unemployment.

Increased Consumer Confidence: With less debt, people would have more money to spend on goods and services, which could lead to increased consumer confidence and spending. This could, in turn, lead to increased demand for goods and services, which could lead to increased production and employment.

Reduced Interest Rates: If all world debt was erased, it would likely lead to a decrease in interest rates. This could make borrowing cheaper and more accessible, which could lead to increased investment and economic growth.

Changes in Monetary Policy: If all world debt was erased, it would likely lead to changes in monetary policy by central banks around the world. Central banks may adjust interest rates, quantitative easing, and other policies to promote economic growth and stability.

Reduced Political Instability: Debt is a major source of political instability, as governments often use debt to fund political campaigns and policies. If all world debt was erased, it could lead to a reduction in political instability and a more stable global political landscape.
